Here are some rules that you should seriously respect to avoid any problem using the library :
To all components (except Border), define an id throught the t:id attribute.
Two css files are present : a core one and skin one. Although the attributes defined in the skin one can be overriden without impacting the component layout, we do not guarantee any modification in the core one.

Each component is designed over a strict relation between the different languages to ensure coherency and increase the development.
Based on the t:id provided to the component, here are the normas you can rely on :
If a JavaScript class is defined for the component, an instance is available through the id provided, allowing to act on the component via JavaScript.
If the JavaScript component uses a YUI one, the YUI instance is available through a yui var contained inside the JavaScript Exanpe component instance
The root HTML tag id is the id provided to the component.
Some component's parameters can be automatically injecting via properties files, based on the component id suffixed (see each component documentation).

CSS properties have been split between core ones (deciding the positionning) and skin ones (declaring the rendering).
Two CSS files are present :
exanpe-t5-lib-core.css
exanpe-t5-lib-skin.css
To customize our component rendering, we strongly advise you to check the skin file and override any of the CSS class that correspond to your needs.
